title: Kapil Dev
summary: Kapil Dev, is a former Indian cricketer who captained the Indian cricket team that won the 1983 World Cup.

value.label: Kapil Dev Ramlal Nikhanj
Chandigarh, India
Indian
All-rounder
One of the greatest all-rounders to have played the game. Right-handed batsman and right-arm pace bowler.
Dev made an impressive debut for Haryana in November 1975 against Punjab.
One day cricket debut against Pakistan where his individual performance was ordinary.

The Pakistan Men's National Cricket Team, popularly referred to as the Shaheens, Green Shirts and Men in Green, is administered by the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB). The team is a Full Member of the International Cricket Council, and participates in Test, ODI and Twenty20 International cricket matches.

image.altText: Image of Pakistan national cricket team

value.label: Both Kapil Dev and India had a poor campaign at the 1979 Cricket World Cup.

The 1979 Cricket World Cup (officially the Prudential Cup '79) was the second edition of the Cricket World Cup and was won by the West Indies, who had also won the inaugural tournament four years earlier. It was held in England from 9 to 23 June 1979.
India won the 1983 world cup under Kapil Dev's captaincy.

The 1983 Cricket World Cup (officially the Prudential Cup '83) was the 3rd edition of the Cricket World Cup tournament. It was held from 9 June to 25 June 1983 in England and Wales and was won by India.
Kapil Dev was retained as the captain of the Indian team for the 1987 World Cup.

The 1987 Cricket World Cup (known as the Reliance Cup 1987 for sponsorship reasons) was the fourth edition of the ICC Cricket World Cup tournament. It was held from 8 October to 8 November 1987 in India and Pakistan.
Kapil Dev played his last world cup in 1992 under the captaincy of Mohammed Azharuddin

The 1992 Cricket World Cup (officially the Benson & Hedges World Cup 1992) was the fifth staging of the Cricket World Cup, organised by the International Cricket Council (ICC). It was held in Australia and New Zealand from 22 February to 25 March 1992 and finished with Pakistan beating England in the final to become the World Cup champions for the first time.
First test century (126) at Feroz Shah Kotla, Delhi in just 124 balls versus West Indies in 1979

image.altText: First test century (126) at Feroz Shah Kotla, Delhi in just 124 balls versus West Indies in 1979

value.label: Two 5 wicket hauls against Australia in a home test series in 1980

image.altText: Two 5 wicket hauls against Australia in a home test series in 1980

value.label: Captained India for the first time in 1982-83 versus Sri Lanka.

image.altText: Captained India for the first time in 1982-83 versus Sri Lanka.

value.label: Scored highest ODI score of 175 not out vs Zimbabwe in 1983 World Cup

value.label: The India national cricket team is also known as Team India and Men in Blue. India is ranked first in Tests, second in ODIs and second in T20Is by the ICC. Virat Kohli is the current captain of the team, while the head coach is Ravi Shastri.
